description:
An introduction to the principles of conservation biology, including
population, community, and ecosystemâlevel approaches. Students will learn
the basics of ecology and population genetics as they pertain to
conservation, interrogate classic case studies in the field, and explore
relevant examples from around Southeast Asia.
title: Conservation Biology
prerequisite: YCC2135 Foundations of Science (Class of 2019) or YCC2132 Foundations of Science 2 (Class of 2018) or YCC2137 Scientific Inquiry 2 (Class of 2020 onwards) or YCC2134 Integrated Science 3 or with permission of the instructor.
